cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.MM, cs.SP. 

The paper deals with the problem of covariance interpolation in massive MIMO systems, which is a topic that falls under the intersection of several sub-fields in computer science. However, given the emphasis on wireless communication and signal processing, it is most likely to be classified under cs.IT (Information Theory) or cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). Additionally, the paper also discusses the use of scatterers and array responses, which are concepts that are commonly used in the fields of signal processing (cs.SP) and multimedia (cs.MM). Finally, the paper proposes a novel technique for UL-DL covariance interpolation, which could potentially fall under the sub-field of systems and control (cs.SI).
